intro: Thesium manikense, commonly known as the Manikense thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent-like growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are typically fleshy and arranged in a basal rosette, which helps it conserve water in dry conditions. Thesium manikense is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
